opendial.bn.distribs.densityfunctions

Interface DensityFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DirichletDensityFunction, DiscreteDensityFunction, GaussianDensityFunction, KernelDensityFunction, UniformDensityFunction

    public interface DensityFunction
    Density function for a continuous probability distribution. The density function can be either univariate or multivariate.
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DensityFunction copy()
      Returns a copy of the density function
      java.util.Map<double[],java.lang.Double> discretise(int nbBuckets)
      Returns a discretised version of the density function.
      java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> generateXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
      Returns the XML representation (as a list of XML elements) of the density function
      double getCDF(double... x)
      Returns the cumulative probability up to the given point x.
      double getDensity(double... x)
      Returns the density value of the function at a given point
      int getDimensions()
      Returns the dimensionality of the density function.
      double[] getMean()
      Returns the mean of the density function.
      double[] getVariance()
      Returns the variance of the density function.
      double[] sample()
      Returns a sampled value given the point.

    • Method Detail

      • getDensity

        double getDensity(double... x)
        Returns the density value of the function at a given point
        Parameters:
        x - the (possibly multivariate) point
        Returns:
        the density value for the point
        Throws:
        DialException - if the density of x could not be calculated.

      • getMean

        double[] getMean()
        Returns the mean of the density function. The size of the double array corresponds to the dimensionality of the function.
        Returns:
        the density mean.

      • getVariance

        double[] getVariance()
        Returns the variance of the density function. The size of the double array corresponds to the dimensionality of the function.
        Returns:
        the density variance

      • sample

        double[] sample()
        Returns a sampled value given the point. The size of the double array corresponds to the dimensionality of the function.
        Returns:
        the sampled value.

      • getDimensions

        int getDimensions()
        Returns the dimensionality of the density function.
        Returns:
        the dimensionality.

      • discretise

        java.util.Map<double[],java.lang.Double> discretise(int nbBuckets)
        Returns a discretised version of the density function. The granularity of the discretisation is defined by the number of discretisation buckets.
        Parameters:
        nbBuckets - the number of discretisation buckets
        Returns:
        a discretised probability distribution, mapping a collection of points to a probability value

      • copy

        DensityFunction copy()
        Returns a copy of the density function
        Returns:
        the copy

      • getCDF

        double getCDF(double... x)
       throws DialException
        Returns the cumulative probability up to the given point x.
        Parameters:
        x - the (possibly multivariate) point x
        Returns:
        the cumulative probability from 0 to x
        Throws:
        DialException - if the CDF could not be extracted

      • generateXML

        java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> generateXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Returns the XML representation (as a list of XML elements) of the density function
        Parameters:
        doc - the XML document for the node
        Returns:
        the corresponding XML elements
